intro: Solenotus vesicarius, commonly known as the blister solenotus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has hairy, herbaceous stems and leaves that are often opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release small, winged seeds.
